processed.result:
There are $n$ possible time periods when someone can attend chess classes, each period is defined by a start time ($l_i$) and an end time ($r_i$). There are $m$ possible time periods when someone can attend programming classes, each period is defined by a start time ($l_j$) and an end time ($r_j$).

The person wants to choose exactly one chess period and exactly one programming period. They want to maximize the distance between these two chosen periods. The distance between two periods ($l_i$, $r_i$) and ($l_j$, $r_j$) is the minimum possible difference between a point in the first period and a point in the second period.

What is the maximum possible distance between the chosen chess and programming periods?
You are given two lists of time intervals.  Choose one interval from each list.  Find the largest possible difference between the end of one interval and the start of the other.
